subject: thoughts to live by
verse: And now, brothers, we want you to know about the grace that God has given the Macedonian churches. Out of the most severe trial, their overflowing joy and their extreme poverty welled up in rich generosity. For I testify that they gave as much as they were able, and even beyond their ability. Entirely on their own, They urgently pleaded with us for the privilege of sharing in this service to the saints. And they did not do as we expected, but they gave themselves first to the Lord and then to us in keeping with God's will. (2 Corinthians 8:1-5) NIV
reflection: During Paul's third missionary journey, he had collected money for the impoverished believers in Jerusalem. The churches in Macedonia ~ Philippic ~ Thessalonian, and Berea had given money even though they were poor, and they had given sacrificially more than Paul had expected. Although they were poor themselves, they wanted to help. The amount we give is not as important as why and how we give. God does not want us to give grudgingly. Instead, He wants us to give as these churches did, out of dedication to Christ ~ love for fellow believers ~ the joy of helping those in need ~ as well as the fact that it was simply the good and right thing to do. How well does your giving measure up to the standards set by the Macedonian churches?
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Forgive me for looking only at the things I do not have, but help me to see all the blessings I have received. Give me a heart of compassion and a love to share what I have with those in need. Amen.
original_content:
06/02/08 ~~~ Food for thought ~~~ The best intelligence test is what we do with our leisure...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

And now, brothers, we want you to know about the grace
that God has given the Macedonian churches...

Out of the most severe trial, their overflowing joy and their
extreme poverty welled up in rich generosity...

For I testify that they gave as much as they were able, and
even beyond their ability. Entirely on their own,

They urgentlly pleaded with us for the privilege of sharing in 
this service to the saints...

And they did not do as we expected, but they gave themselves 
first to the Lord and then to us in keeping with God's will...(2 Cor. 8:1-5) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

During Paul's third missionary journey, he had collected money 
for the impoverished believers in Jerusalem. The churches in
Macedonia ~ Philippi ~ Thessalonica, and Berea had given money 
even though they were poor, and they had given sacrificially more 
than Paul had expected. Although they were poor themselves, 
they wanted to help...

The amount we give is not as important as why and how we give.
God does not want us to give grudgingly. Instead, He wants us to
give as these churches did, out of dedication to Christ ~ love for 
fellow believers ~ the joy of helping those in need ~ as well as the 
fact that it was simply the good and right thing to do...

How well does your giving measure up to the standards set by the 
Macedonian churches?

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Forgive me for looking only at the 
things I do not have, but help me to see all the blessings
I have received. Give me a heart of compassion and a love
to share what I have with those in need...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will help you see what is important...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: (a continuation of our last devotion) Paul says: I testify that they gave as much as they were able, and even beyond their ability. Entirely on their own, They urgently pleaded with us for the privilege of sharing in the service to the saints. And they did not do as we expected, but they gave themselves first to the Lord and then to us in keeping with God's will. So we urged Titus, since he had earlier made a beginning, to bring also to completion this act of grace on your part. (2 Corinthians 8:3-6) NIV
reflection: We should realize that the Kingdom of God spreads through believers concern and eagerness to help others. Here we see several churches joining to help others beyond their own circle of friends and their own city. We should explore ways that we can link up with a ministry outside our own city, either through our church or through a Christian organization. By joining with other believers to do God's work we increase Christian unity and help the kingdom grow.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me not to be so concerned about myself, and more concerned about the welfare of others. Show me ways to share the blessing I have received with others less fortunate. Bless those who are reading this devotion by helping them to see the needs of others. Amen.
original_content:
06/03/08 ~~~ (thoughts to live by ~~~There's no success like failure,
but failure's no success at all...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

(a continuation of our last devotion) Paul says:
I testify that they gave as much as they were able, and even
beyond their ability. Entirely on their own,

They urgently pleaded with us for the privilege of sharing in
the service to the saints...

And they did not do as we expected, but they gave themselves 
first to the Lord and then to us in keeping with God's will...

So we urged Titus, since he had earlier made a beginning, to
bring also to completion this act of grace on your part...(2 Cor 8:3-6) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

We should realize that the Kingdom of God spreads through 
believers concern and eagerness to help others. Here we see 
several churches joining to help others beyond their own circle
of friends and their own city...

We should explore ways that we can link up with a ministry outside
our own city, either through our church or through a Christian
organization. By joining with other believers to do God's work we
increase Christian unity and help the kingdom grow...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me not to be so concerned about
myself, and more concerned about the welfare of others. Show
me ways to share the blessing I have received with others less
fortunate. Bless those who are reading this devotion by helping
them to see the needs of others...Amen

Keep looking up, it is the best way to gain true wisdom...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: (Paul continues) But just as you excel in everything ~ in faith, in speech, in knowledge, in complete earnestness and in your love for us ~ see that you also excel in this grace of giving. I am not commanding you, but I want to test the sincerity of your love by comparing it with the earnestness of others. (2 Corinthians 8:7, 8) NIV
reflection: By what Paul writes it would seem that the Corinthian believers excelled in everything ~ they had faith, gifted speakers, knowledge, enthusiasm, and love. But Paul also wanted them to be leaders in giving. Giving is a natural response of love. We need to remember that Paul did not order the Corinthians to give, but he encouraged them to prove that their love was real. When we truly love someone, we should want to give that person our time and attention and provide for his or her needs. If we refuse to help, our love is not as genuine as we say.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, thank you for the many blessing I have received in my life time. You know that I love You because You know my heart ~ But those I wish to know my love for them do not know me as You do~ so please Lord help me to better prove my love for them. Amen.

But Paul also wanted them to be leaders in giving. Giving is a natural
response of love. We need to remember that Paul did not order the

real...

When we truly love someone, we should want to give that person
our time and attention and provide for his or her needs. If we

Keep looking up, love elevates us to a higher calling...
You are in the prayers of two who love you...

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul continues: Here is my advise about what is best for you in this matter: Last year you were the first not only to give but also to have the desire to do so. Now finish the work, so that your eager willingness to do it may be matched by your completion of it, according to your means. For if the willingness is there, the gift is acceptable according to what it has, not according to what it does not have. Our desire is not that others might be relieved while you are hard pressed, but that there might be equality. (2 Corinthians 8:10-13) NIV
reflection: The Christians in the Corinthian church had money, and apparently they had planned to collect money for the Jerusalem church a year earlier (see 2 Corinthians 9:2). Paul challenges them to act on these plans. We should see that four principles of giving emerge here: 1) Your willingness to give enthusiastically is more important than the amount you give; 2) You should strive to fulfill your financial commitments; 3) If you give to others in need, they will, in turn, help you when you are in need; 4) You should give as a response to Christ, not for anything you can get out of it. How you give reflects your devotion to Christ.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always be mindful of the needs of others. Temper my heart with grace and mercy, give me a forgiving heart I pray in Jesus name. Amen.
original_content:
06/05/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Your character is built by what you stand for,
your reputation by what you fall for...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul continues: Here is my advise about what is best for you
in this matter: Last year you were the first not only to give but
also to have the desire to do so...

Now finish the work, so that your eager willingness to do it may
be matched by your completion of it, according to your means...

For if the willingness is there, the gift is acceptable according 
to what it has, not according to what it does not have...

Our desire is not that others might be relieved while you are hard 
pressed, but that there might be equality...(2 Cor. 8:10-13) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The Christians in the Corinthian church had money, and apparently
they had planned to collect money for the Jerusalem church a year
earlier (see 2 Cor. 9:2)...

Paul challenges them to act on these plans. We should see that
four principles of giving emerge here:

1) Your willingness to give enthusiastically is more important than
the amount you give;
2) You should strive to fulfil your financial commitments;
3) If you give to others in need, they will, in turn, help you when you are in need;
4) You should give as a response to Christ, not for anything you can get out of it.

How you give reflects your devotion to Christ...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always be mindful of 
the needs of others. Temper my heart with grace and
mercy, give me a forgiving heart I pray in Jesus name...Amen.

Keep looking up, and your heart will be changed...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul surely understood human nature, He says: "For if the willingness is there, the gift is acceptable according to what one has, not according to what he does not have. Our desire is not that others might be relieved while you are hard pressed, but that there might be equality. (2 Corinthians 8:12, 13) NIV
reflection: Paul says that we should give of what we have, not what we don't have. Sacrificial giving must be responsible giving. Paul wants believers to give generously but not to the extent that those who depend on the givers (their families for example) must go without having their basic needs met. Give until it hurts, but don't give tell it hurts your family and/or relatives who need your financial support.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to be a more responsible giver ~ help me to always remember all that I have is a gift from you, and was not meant to be used only to please my own comforts. Amen.

pressed, but that there might be equality...(2 Cor. 8:12, 13) NIV

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Remember this: whoever sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and whoever sows generously will also reap generously. Each man should give what he has decided in his heart to give, not reluctantly or under compulsion, for God loves a cheerful giver. And God is able to make all grace abound to you so that in all things at all times, having all that you need, you will abound in every good work. (2 Corinthians 9:6-8) NIV
reflection: People often hesitate to give generously to God because they worry about having enough money left over to meet their own needs. Paul assured the Corinthians that God was able to meet their needs. We need to remember that our attitude is more important than the amount we give. We don't have to be embarrassed if we can give only a small gift. God is concerned about how we give from the resources we have (see Mark 12:41-44). According to that standard, the giving of the Macedonian churches would be difficult to match (8:3).
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I find myself falling short in so many areas of my life when I consider all that You have done for me. Help me to be more faithful in my walk with You. Amen.
original_content:

And God is able to make all grace abound to you so that in all things 
at all times, having all that you need, you will abound in every good 
work...(2 Cor. 9:6-8) NIV

their own needs...

Paul assured the Corinthians that God was able to meet their
needs...

We need to remember that our attitude is more important

if we can give only a small gift...

God is concerned about how we give from the resources we 
have (see Mk. 12:41-44). According to that standard, the
giving of the Macedonian churches would be difficult to match (8:3).

Our Prayer for Today:

Keep looking up, He may be speaking to You today...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Now He who supplies seed to the sower and bread for food will also supply and increase your store of seed and will enlarge the harvest of your righteousness. (2 Corinthians 9:10) NIV
reflection: God gives us resources to use and invest for Him. Paul uses the illustration of seed to explain that the resources God gives us are not to be hidden ~ foolishly devoured ~ or thrown away. Instead ~ they should be cultivated in order to produce more crops. When we invest what God has given us in His work He will provide us with even more to give in His service.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the many blessings You have provided me with, give me wisdom to use these gifts wisely to further Your Kingdoms work. Amen.
original_content:

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: This service that you perform is not only supplying the needs of God's people but is also overflowing in many expressions of thanks to God. Because of the service by which you have proved yourselves, men will praise God for the obedience that accompanies your confession of the gospel of Christ, and for your generosity in sharing with them and with everyone else. And in their prayers for you their hearts will go out to you, because of the surpassing grace God has given you. Thanks be to God for His indescribable gift. (2 Corinthians 9:12-15) NIV
reflection: Paul emphasizes the spiritual rewards for those who give generously to God's work. We should never expect to become wealthy through giving. Those who receive your gifts will be helped, will praise God, and will pray for you. As you bless others, you will be blessed.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, remind me to share of the many blessing I have received from You with those who are not as fortunate as I have been. I pray for good health and safety for each person who will read this message. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For though we live in the world we do not wage war as the world does. The weapons we fight with are not the weapons of the world. on the contrary, they have divine power to demolish strongholds. We demolish arguments and every pretension that sets itself up against the knowledge of God and we take captive every thought to make it obedient to Christ. (2 Corinthians 10:3-5) NIV
reflection: We, like Paul, are merely weak humans, but we don't need to use human plans and methods to win our battles. God's mighty weapons are available to us as we fight against the devils "strongholds." the Christian must choose whose methods to use ~ God's or the world's. Paul assures us that God's mighty weapons ~ prayer, faith, hope, love, God's Word, the Holy Sprit ~ are powerful and effective (see Eph. 6:12-18). These weapons can break down the proud human arguments against God and the walls that Satan builds to keep people from finding God.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the weapons that are available to all Christians to break down Satan's barriers to God. I thank you for that power. Amen.
original_content:

but after awhile they know something...

You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al and Marcie Sather...

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul says: "I do not want to seem to be trying to frighten you with my letters. For some say, 'His letters are weighty and forceful, but in person he is unimpressive and his speaking amounts to nothing. ' Such people should realize that what we are in our letters when we are absent, we will be in our actions when we are present. (2 Corinthians 10:9-11) NIV
reflection: Some were saying that Paul's speaking amounted to nothing. Greece was known for its eloquent and persuasive orators. Evidently, some were judging Paul by comparing him to other speakers they had heard, and perhaps Paul was not the most powerful preacher, (but he was an excellent debater). What we need to remember is that Paul was responding obediently to God's call and so introduced Christianity to the Roman empire. If we look to Exodus 4:10-12 and Jeremiah 1:6 we will see that Moses and Jeremiah also had problems speaking. Preaching ability is not the first prerequisite of a great leader, what is most important is remaining faithful.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father I thank You for faithful men like Paul. Because of them we have Your printed Word today. Help me to stand firm on Your Word. Amen.
original_content:
06/12/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ The lessons which are remembered the longest
are those which are taught by example...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul says: "I do not want to seem to be trying to frighten you
with my letters...

For some say, 'His letters are weighty and forceful, but in 
person he is unimpressive and his speaking amounts to nothing.'

Such people should realize that what we are in our letters when
we are absent, we will be in our actions when we are present...(2 Cor. 10:9-11) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Some were saying that Paul's speaking amounted to nothing.
Greece was known for its eloquent and persuasive orators...

Evidently, some were judging Paul by comparing him to other
speakers they had heard, and perhaps Paul was not the most 
powerful preacher, (but he was an excellent debater).

What we need to remember is that Paul was responding obediently
to God's call and so introduced Christianity to the Roman empire...

If we look to Ex. 4:10-12 and Jer. 1:6 we will see that Moses and 
Jeremiah also had problems speaking...

Preaching ability is not the first prerequisite of a great leader, what
is most important is remaining faithful...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father I thank You for faithful men like Paul.
Because of them we have Your printed Word today. Help
me to stand firm on Your Word...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is our Commander and Chief...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul says: "Let him who boasts boast in the Lord." For it is not the one who commends himself who is approved, but the one whom the Lord commends. (2 Corinthians 10:17, 18) NIV
reflection: When we do something well, we want to tell others and be recognized. But recognition is dangerous ~ it can lead to inflated pride. It is so much better to seek the praise of God rather than the praise of people. Then ~ when we receive praise, we will be free to give God the credit. What are some things you should change about the way you live in order to receive God's commendation?
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, if I should receive praise, I pray that I would not become prideful. For I know that all that I do is possible only through You. So, help me to always give You the credit. Amen.
original_content:
06/13/08 ~~~ (Food for thought) ~~~Enthusiasm is contagious, and so is the lack of it...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul says: "Let him who boasts boast in the Lord."

For it is not the one who commends himself who

It is so much better to seek the praise of God rather than
the praise of people. Then ~ when we receive praise, we
will be free to give God the credit...

Our Prayer for Today:

give You the credit...Amen.

Keep looking up, our strength comes from above...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul says: "I am afraid that just as Eve was deceived by the serpent's cunning, your minds may somehow be led astray from your sincere and pure devotion to Christ. (2 Corinthians 11:3) NIV
reflection: The Corinthians pure and simple devotion to Christ was being threatened by false teaching. Paul did not want the believers to lose their singe-minded love for Christ. Keeping Christ first in our life can be very difficult when we have so many distractions threatening to sidetrack our faith. Just as Eve lost her focus by listening to the Serpent, we too can lose our focus by letting our life become overcrowded and confused.
prayer: Is there anything that weakens your commitment to keep Christ first in your life? What are someways you can minimize the distractions that threaten your devotion to Christ??? Amen.
original_content:
06/14/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ The first and most important step toward
success is the feeling that we can succeed...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Paul says: "I am afraid that just as Eve was deceived by
the serpent's cunning, your minds may somehow be led 
astray from your sincere and pure devotion to Christ...
(2 Cor. 11:3) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The Corinthians pure and simple devotion to Christ was being
threatened by false teaching. Paul did not want the believers 
to lose their singe-minded love for Christ...

Keeping Christ first in our life can be very difficult when we have
so many distractions threatening to sidetrack our faith. Just as Eve 
lost her focus by listening to the Serpent, we too can lose our focus
by letting our life become overcrowded and confused...

Is there anything that weakens your commitment to keep Christ first
in your life?

What are someways you can minimize the distractions that threaten 
your devotion to Christ???

Keep looking up, keep your focus totally on Him...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul's says, "I may not be a trained speaker, but I do have knowledge. We have made this perfectly clear to you in every way. Was it a sin for me to lower myself in order to elevate you by preaching the gospel of God to you free of charge. (2 Corinthians 11:6, 7) NIV
reflection: The Corinthians may have thought that preachers could be judged by how much money they demanded. A good speaker would charge a large sum, a fair speaker would be a little cheaper, a poor speaker would be free. The false teacher may have argued that because Paul asked no fee for his preaching, he must have been an amateur, with little authority or competence. Believers today must be careful not to assume that every preacher or evangelist who is well known or who demands a large honorarium is superior at teaching God's Word.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for the simple clear messages, that are easy to understand. I thank you for Your Word, for it is a lamp onto my feet and a light onto my path, for without Your Word each day I would stumble and fall for may of Satan's knifing ways. Amen.
original_content:
06/16/08 ~~~ (Food for thought) ~~~No bird soars too high if it soars with its own wings...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul's says, "I may not be a trained speaker, but I do have knowledge.
We have made this perfectly clear to you in every way...

Was it a sin for me to lower myself in order to elevate you by preaching
the gospel of God to you free of charge...(2 Cor 11:6, 7) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The Corinthians may have thought that preachers could be judged
by how much money they demanded. A good speaker would charge
a large sum, a fair speaker would be a little cheaper, a poor speaker 
would be free...

The false teacher may have argued that because Paul asked no fee
for his preaching, he must have been an amateur, with little authority
or competence...

Believers today must be careful not to assume that every preacher
or evangelist who is well known or who demands a large honorarium
is superior at teaching God's Word...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for the simple clear 
messages, that are easy to understand. I thank you for
Your Word, for it is a lamp onto my feet and a light onto
my path, for without Your Word each day I would stumble
and fall for may of Satan's knifing ways...Amen.

Keep looking up, His salvation is free...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul is still speaking about the false preachers that the Corinthians were dealing with. For such men are false apostles. deceitful workmen, masquerading as apostles of Christ. And no wonder, for Satan himself masquerades as an angel of light. It is not surprising, then, if his servant masquerade as servants of righteousness. Their end will be what their actions deserve. (2 Corinthians 11:13-15) NIV
reflection: Satan and his servants can also deceive us by appearing to be attractive, good, and moral. Many unexciting people follow smooth-talking. Bible quoting leaders into cults that alienate them from their families and lead them into the practice of immorality and deceit. Don't be fooled by external appearances. Our impressions alone are not an accurate indicator of who is or isn't a true follower of Christ. SO, it helps to ask questions: (1) Do the teachings confirm Scriptures (Acts 17:11)? (2) Does the teacher affirm and proclaim that Christ is God who came into the world as a man to save people from their sins(1 John 4:1-3)? (3) Is the teachers life style consistent with biblical morality (Matthew 12:33-37)?
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for godly wisdom, so that I would not be lead astray by the fashionable preachers of the day. Help me to examine closely what is being preached. Amen.
original_content:
06/ 17/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Great souls stutter in silence...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul is still speaking about the false preachers that 
the Corinthians were dealing with...

For such men are false apostles. deceitful workmen, 
masquerading as apostles of Christ...

And no wonder, for Satan himself masquerades as 
an angel of light...

It is not surprising, then, if his servant masquerade as 
servants of righteousness. Their end will be what their 
actions deserve... (2 Cor. 11:13-15) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Satan and his servants can also deceive us by appearing
to be attractive, good, and moral. Many unexacting people
follow smooth-talking... 

Bible quoting leaders into cults that alienate them from their 
families and lead them into the practice of immorality and 
deceit...

Don't be fooled by external appearances. Our impressions 
alone are not an accurate indicator of who is or isn't a true 
follower of Christ...

SO, it helps to ask questions:
(1) Do the teachings confirm Scriptures (Acts 17:11)?
(2) Does the teacher affirm and proclaim that Christ is 
God who came into the world as a man to save people
from their sins(1 Jn 4:1-3)?
(3) Is the teachers life style consistent with biblical morality
(Mt. 12:33-37)?

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for godly wisdom, so that
I would not be lead astray by the fashionable preachers 
of the day. Help me to examine closely what is being 
preached...Amen.

Keep looking up, true wisdom comes from above...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul was especially concerned for these new churches because of the many false teachers, he says: "besides everything else, I face daily the pressure of my concern for all the churches. Who is weak, and I do not feel weak? Who is led into sin, and I do not inwardly burn? (2 Corinthians 11:28, 29) NIV
reflection: Not only did Paul face beatings and dangers, he also carried the daily concern for the young churches. He worried whether they would stay true to the Good News and free from false teachings, and inner strife. Paul was concerned for individuals in the churches he had served. If God has place you in a position of leadership and authority treat people with Paul's kind of empathy and concern.
prayer: Dear Lord Jesus, Help me remember to keep Your people in my prayers. Help me to always be faithful in reaching out to those who need to know You. Amen.

06/18/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~All our dreams can come true if

"besides everything else, I face daily the pressure of my
concern for all the churches...

Who is weak, and I do not feel weak? Who is led into sin,
and I do not inwardly burn? (2 Cor. 11:28, 29) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Not only did Paul face beatings and dangers, he also carried
the daily concern for the young churches. He worried whether
they would stay true to the Good News and free from false
teachings, and inner strife...

Paul was concerned for individuals in the churches he had served.

If God has place you in a position of leadership and authority
treat people with Paul's kind of empathy and concern...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord Jesus, Help me remember to keep Your people
in my prayers. Help me to always be faithful in reaching out
to those who need to know You...Amen.

Keep looking up, from where our strength comes...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I know a man in Christ who fourteen years ago was caught up to the third heaven. Whether it was in the body or out of the body I do not know~~God knows. And I know that this man ~ whether in the body or apart from the body I do not know but God knows, was caught up into paradise. He heard inexpressive things, things that man is not permitted to tell. (2 Corinthians 12:2-4) NIV
reflection: Paul continued his "boasting" by telling about visions and revelations he had received from the Lord, Paul explained that he didn't know if he was taken up in his body or in his spirit. This incident cannot be positively identified with a recorded event in Paul's career, although some think this may have been when he was stoned and left for dead (Acts 14:19, 20). Our Lesson for Today: The reason Paul told about this incident was to show that he had been uniquely touched by God. . Suppose you had, had such an experience could you explain it any better that Paul?
prayer: Dear heavenly Father, I thank You for Paul's experience. It is not to difficult to imagine that he was speechless because of the sounds and the beauty of the place that has been prepared for us. Help us to be prepared for our departure. Amen.
original_content:

a most becoming light on others...

body or out of the body I do not know~~God knows.

from the body I do not know but God knows,

was caught up into paradise. He heard inexpressive things, 
things that man is not permitted to tell...(2 Cor 12:2-4) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul continued his "boasting" by telling about visions

This incident cannot be positively identified with a

dead (Acts 14:19, 20).

Keep looking up, He has prepared a place for you...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: But He said to me, "My grace is sufficient for you, for My power is made perfect in weakness. Therefore I will boast all the more gladly about my weakness, so that Christ's power may rest on me. (2 Corinthians 12:9) NIV
reflection: Paul prayed that God would remove his affliction, But God did not do it because He wanted to demonstrate His power through Paul. The fact that God's power is displaced in our weakness should give us courage and hope. As we recognize our limitations, we will depend more on God for our effectiveness rather than on our own energy, effort, or talent. Our limitations not only help develop Christian character but also deep our worship, because in admitting them, we affirm God's strength.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your love and mercies which are new every day. I thank You for my e-mail friends and I pray that You would bless them with good health and safety. Amen.
original_content:
06/20/08 ~~~(food for thought) ~~~ Next to good judgement, diamonds and pearls
are the rarest things in the world...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

But He said to me, "My grace is sufficient for you, for My power is made 
perfect in weakness. Therefore I will boast all the more gladly about my
weakness, so that Christ's power may rest on me...(2 Cor. 12:9) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul prayed that God would remove his affliction, But God did not do
it because He wanted to demonstrate His power through Paul. The 
fact that God's power is displaced in our weakness should give us
courage and hope...

As we recognize our limitations, we will depend more on God for our
effectiveness rather than on our own energy, effort, or talent...

Our limitations not only help develop Christian character but also deep
our worship, because in admitting them, we affirm God's strength...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your love and mercies
which are new every day. I thank You for my e-mail friends and 
I pray that You would bless them with good health and safety...Amen

Keep looking up, God answers prayer...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul has just said that God would not remove his thorn in the flesh as he calls it. (Paul says) That is why, for Christ's sake, I delight in weakness, in insults, in hardships, in persecutions, in difficulties. For when I am weak, then am I strong. (2 Corinthians 12:10) NIV
reflection: When we are strong in abilities or resources, we are tempted to do Gods work on our own, and that can lead to pride. When we are weak, allowing God to fill us with His power, then we are stronger than we could ever be on our own, , , God does not intend for us to be weak, passive, or ineffectual, Life provides enough hindrance and setbacks without us creating them. When those obstacles come we must depend on God. Only His power will make us effective for him.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to remember to turn all my problems over to you, guide and direct my life I pray. Amen.
original_content:
06/21/08~~~(food for thought)~~~Leave everything a little better than you found it...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Paul has just said that God would not remove his thorn in the flesh
as he calls it...(Paul says)

That is why, for Christ's sake, I delight in weakness, in insults, in
hardships, in persecutions, in difficulties. For when I am weak,
then am I strong...(2 Cor. 12:10) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

When we are strong in abilities or resources, we are
tempted to do Gods work on our own, and that can 
lead to pride...

When we are weak, allowing God to fill us with His power, 
then we are stronger than we could ever be on our own,,,

God does not intend for us to be weak, passive, or ineffectual,
Life provides enough hindrance and set-backs without us 
creating them...

When those obstacles come we must depend on God. Only
His power will make us effective for him...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to remember to turn all
my problems over to you, guide and direct my life I pray...
Amen.

Keep looking up, He is always there for you...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul says: "I have made a fool of myself, but you drove me to it. I ought to have been commended by you, for I am not in the least inferior to the "super-apostles, " even though I am nothing. The things that mark an apostle ~ signs, wonders and miracles ~ were done among you with great perseverance. (2 Corinthians 12:11, 12) NIV
reflection: Paul was not merely revealing his feelings, he was defending his authority as an apostle of Jesus Christ. Paul had been hurt by the church of Corinth by their doubting and questioning him, so he defended himself for the cause of the "Good News." When people question you, do you only think of saving your reputation OR are you more concerned about what people will think about Christ?
prayer: Dear heavenly Father, I pray that my words and actions would not be an offense to You. I pray that I would always remember that as a believer I am representing You. Amen.
original_content:
06/23/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Finding fault is the most common type of unskilled labor...

Paul says: "I have made a fool of myself, but you drove me to it.
I ought to have been commended by you, for I am not in the least
inferior to the "super-apostles," even though I am nothing...

The things that mark an apostle ~ signs, wonders and miracles ~
were done among you with great perseverance...(2 Cor. 12:11, 12) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul was not merely revealing his feelings, he was defending his authority 
as an apostle of Jesus Christ. 

Paul had been hurt by the church of Corinth by their doubting and questioning 
him, so he defended himself for the cause of the "Good News." 

When people question you, do you only think of saving your reputation OR
are you more concerned about what people will think about Christ?

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul writes: "I am afraid that when I come I may not find you as I want you to be, and you may not find me as you want me to be. I fear that there may be quarreling, jealousy, outburst of anger, factions, slander, gossip, arrogance and disorder. I am afraid that when I come again my God will humble me before you, and I will be grieved over many who have sinned earlier and have not repented of the impurity, sexual sin and debauchery in which they have indulged. (2 Corinthians 12:20, 21) NIV
reflection: After reading this list of sins, it is hard to believe that these are the people that Paul said possessed great gifts and excelled as leaders (8:7). Paul feared that the practices of wicked Corinth had invaded the congregation. He wrote sternly, hoping that they would straighten out their lives before he arrived. This should be a warning to us who believe, not to let the secular society dictate how we are to treat others. We should not let culture influence our behavior.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to heed Paul's warning to stay clear of secular behavior. Forgive me for the sins I have committed. Bless each and every e-mail friend today with good health and safety. Amen.
original_content:

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Examine yourselves to see whether you are in the faith; test yourselves. Do you not realize that Christ Jesus is in you ~ unless of course, you fail the test? (2 Corinthians 13:5) NIV
reflection: The Corinthians were called to examine and test themselves to see if they were really Christians. Just as we get physical check ups, Paul urges us to give ourselves spiritual checkups. We should look for a growing awareness of Christ's presence and power in our life. We need this checkup to see if we are true Christians or merely impostors. If we are not actively seeking to grow closer to God, we are drawing father away from Him.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would help me to make an honest examination of my spiritual health. Open my spiritual eyes to any sins that I am unaware of. Amen.
original_content:
06/25/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Often the voice of conscience has a difficult
time making connections with the ears...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Examine yourselves to see whether you are in the faith;

in you ~ unless of course, you fail the test? (2 Cor. 13:5) NIV

The Corinthians were called to examine and test themselves to see
if they were really Christians...

Just as we get physical check ups, Paul urges us to give ourselves
spiritual checkups. We should look for a growing awareness of Christ's
presence and power in our life...

We need this checkup to see if we are true Christians or merely

You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather...

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: We can not do anything against the truth, but only for the truth. We are glad whenever we are weak but you are strong; and our prayer is for your projection. (2 Corinthians 13:8, 9) NIV
reflection: Just as parents want their children to grow into mature adults, so Paul wanted the Corinthians to grow into mature Christians. As we share the Good News, our goal should be not merely to see others profess faith or begin attending church but to see them become mature in their faith. Don't set your sights too low.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to be faithful to share the Good News ~ so that others will mature in their faith. Bless each of my e-mail friends with safety and good health. Amen.
original_content:
06/26/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Life is just on foolish thing after another, and
love is just one foolish thing after each other...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

We are glad whenever we are weak but you are strong; and
our prayer is for your projection...(2 Cor 13:8, 9) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Just as parents want their children to grow into mature adults,
so Paul wanted the Corinthians to grow into mature Christians...

As we share the Good News, our goal should be not merely
to see others profess faith or begin attending church but to

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Finally, brothers, good-by. Aim for perfection, listen to my appeal, be of one mind, live in peace. And the God of love and will be with you. (2 Corinthians 13:11) NIV
reflection: Paul's closing words ~ what he wanted the Corinthians to remember about the needs facing their church ~ are still fitting for the church today. When these qualities are not present, there are problems that will have to be dealt with. These traits do not come to a church by glossing over problems, conflicts, and difficulties. They are not produced by neglect, denial, withdrawal, or bitterness. They are the byproducts of the extremely hard work of solving problems. Just as Paul and the Corinthians had to hammer out difficulties to bring peace, so we must apply the principles of God's Word and not just hear them.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help our church to be of one mind, help us to live in peace. Help us to be like minded. help us to scrap all ideas that we can not come to a consensus about. Amen.
original_content:
06/27/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ If you really think about it, life is nothing but
an experiment that we are all new at...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Finally, brothers, good-by. Aim for perfection, listen to my
appeal, be of one mind, live in peace. And the God of love 
and will be with you...(2 Cor. 13:11) NIV

Paul's closing words ~ what he wanted the Corinthians to remember
about the needs facing their church ~ are still fitting for the church today.

When these qualities are not present, there are problems that will have
to be dealt with. These traits do not come to a church by glossing over
problems, conflicts, and difficulties...

They are not produced by neglect, denial, withdrawal, or bitterness. They
are the by-products of the extremely hard work of solving problems...

Just as Paul and the Corinthians had to hammer out difficulties to bring 
peace, so we must apply the principles of God's Word and not just hear 
them...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help our church to be of one mind,
help us to live in peace. Help us to be like minded. help
us to scrap all ideas that we can not come to a consensus
about...Amen.

Keep looking up, for Godly wisdom...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ, Who gave Himself for our sins to rescue us from the present evil age, according to the will of our God and Father, to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen. (Galatians 1:3-5) NIV
reflection: God's plan all along was to save us by Jesus' death. We have been rescued from the power of this present world a world ruled by Satan and full of cruelty, tragedy, temptation, and deception. Being rescued from this evil world doesn't mean that we are taken out it but that we are no longer enslaved to it. You were saved to live for God. Does your life reflect your gratitude for being rescued? Have you transformed your loyalty from this world to Christ???
prayer: I thank You again today for taking my place upon the cross. I pray that my life reflects my gratitude for saving my life Amen.
original_content:
06/28/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Kind words can be short and easy to speak
but their echoes are truly endless...

Who gave Himself for our sins to rescue us from the present evil age,
according to the will of our God and Father,

to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen...(Gal. 1:3-5) NIV

You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I am astonished that you are so quickly deserting the one who called you by the grace of Christ and are turning to a different gospel. (Galatians 1:6) NIV
reflection: Some people were preaching "a different way." They were teaching that to be saved, Gentile believers had to follow Jewish laws and customs, especially the rite of circumcision. They were preaching that faith in Christ was not enough. This message undermined the truth that salvation is a gift, not a reward for certain deeds. Jesus Christ has made this gift available to all people. Beware of people who say that we need more than simple faith in Christ to be saved. When people set up additional requirements for salvation, they deny the power of Christ's death on the cross (see Galatians 3:1-5).
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You for the gift of salvation that is ours through faith in the finished work of Christ on the cross. Make this clear to all who read this today. Amen.
original_content:
06/30/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Beware of false doctrine

Our Bible verse for today:

I am astonished that you are so quickly deserting the one 
who called you by the grace of Christ and are turning to a
different gospel...(Gal 1:6) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Some people were preaching "a different way." They were
teaching that to be saved, Gentile believers had to follow
Jewish laws and customs, especially the rite of circumcision...

They were preaching that faith in Christ was not enough. This
message undermined the truth that salvation is a gift, not a reward
for certain deeds. Jesus Christ has made this gift available to all
people...

Beware of people who say that we need more than simple faith in 
Christ to be saved. When people set up additional requirements 
for salvation, they deny the power of Christ's death on the cross
(see Gal. 3:1-5).

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord, I thank You for the gift of salvation that is ours
through faith in the finished work of Christ on the cross.
Make this clear to all who read this today...Amen.

Keep looking up, God has a blessing for you today...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Evidently some people are throwing you into confusion and are trying to pervert the Gospel of Christ. (Galatians 1:7) NIV
reflection: The Bible says there is only one way to be forgiven of sin ~ which is by believing in Jesus Christ as Lord and Savior. No other person or method, or ritual can give eternal life. Attempting to be open minded and tolerant, some people assert that all religions are equally valid paths to God. In a free society, people have the right to their opinions, but this does not guarantee that their ideas are right. God does not accept man-made religions as a substitute for faith in Jesus Christ. He has provided just one way ~ Jesus Christ (John 14:6).
prayer: Dear Lord Jesus, I thank You for the sure way to inherit eternal life. I pray that One Day soon all will come to know the truth. Amen.
original_content:
07/01/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ The way of the world is the way of perdition...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Evidently some people are throwing you into confusion and 
are trying to pervert the Gospel of Christ...(Gal. 1:7) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The Bible says there is only one way to be forgiven of sin ~
which is by believing in Jesus Christ as Lord and Savior...

No other person or method, or ritual can give eternal life. 

Attempting to be open minded and tolerant, some people 
assert that all religions are equally valid paths to God. In a
free society, people have the right to their opinions, but this 
does not guarantee that their ideas are right...

God does not accept man-made religions as a substitute for
faith in Jesus Christ. He has provided just one way ~ 
Jesus Christ (Jn. 14:6)...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord Jesus, I thank You for the sure way to inherit eternal life.
I pray that One Day soon all will come to know the truth...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is the only Way...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Grand-pa Al & Grand-ma Marcie
